text: Horsfieldia ampliformis is a small rainforest tree in the family Myristicaceae, endemic to Papua New Guinea. It is only known to exist in the former Sepik Province (now East Sepik and Sandaun Provinces) and Morobe Province, where it grows in rainforests in the foothills and low areas of mountains. ==References== Category:Flora of Papua New Guinea ampliformis Category:Vulnerable plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Horsfieldia ampliformis
